title: Major League Cricket granted official List-A status by ICC
body:
Ahead of its highly anticipated second season commencing July 5, Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) has been granted official List-A Status by the International Cricket Council (ICC)

This significant development marks yet another crucial milestone in the growth and status of Cognizant Major League Cricket, and cricket more broadly in the United States. It recognizes the Cognizant Major League Cricket as an official T20 league and America’s first world-class domestic tournament, according to an MLC release.

READ: Major League Cricket tickets go on sale for 2024 season (May 15, 2024)

Now, every century, half-century, ‘five-for’, run-out, win, loss, and championship will be documented as official career statistics in an internationally recognized format of the game, it noted.

This will also provide local US players and upcoming stars of the game the opportunity for international recognition, furthering the development of domestic talent by the MLC, the release stated.

READ: Cognizant joins Major League Cricket as title partner (March 15, 2024)

The List-A Status comes after the MLC’s successful inaugural season and underscores its unwavering dedication to delivering premier cricket in the United States.

In addition to the official List-A status, MLC CEO, Vijay Srinivasan, recently announced aspirations to expand from what began as a 19-game season in 2023 to a 34-game season by 2025.

“We saw cricket mania sweep across the US last year off the back of our inaugural season of Major League Cricket. Now, we take exciting momentum into the highly anticipated ICC T20 World Cup and season two of the MLC,” he stated.

“With an unforgettable summer of cricket on our doorstep, we’re ready to capture the hearts of American sports fans with our thrilling, adrenaline-charged game that is the most exciting emerging T20 tournament across the globe.”

After sell-out crowds in the inaugural season, MLC encouraged fans to purchase their tickets early to ensure they don’t miss out on the action this season. In addition to the world-class matches, fans have several ticket options, with general admission tickets starting at $30 per person.

The season’s excitement extends beyond the pitch, with entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings and meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the tournament, according the release.

Tickets for all matches, including the four playoffs, are available online at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com

title: David Miller gets roped in by Los Angeles Knight Riders ahead of MLC season 2
body:
Los Angeles Knight Riders have roped South African big-hitter David Miller for the upcoming season of the Major League Cricket. LAKR, the sister franchise of IPL champions KKR, finished last in 2023, having just won one game out of their 5 matches and failed to reach the playoffs.

Miller comes in as a big signing for LAKR, as he played for Texas Super Kings, the sister franchise of CSK. LAKR made the move official on their social media platforms on May 30, Thursday. Miller's move to the Los Angeles-based franchise comes days after they had brought in veteran Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan to the team.

Miller had a hot and cold IPL 2024 campaign with GT this year as the former champions had a season to forget. Miller's time with the team was marred by injuries as he missed a lot of crucial matches and wasn't in the best form after his injury.

Miller scored just 210 runs in 9 matches for Gujarat at an average of 35 with one fifty to his name. GT would end up missing out on reaching the Playoffs this season and finished 8th in the table.

LAKR's squad so far

Ahead of the new season of MLC, LAKR have made some big moves as they look to reach the Playoffs. The Los Angeles-based side had already retained the likes of Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Jason Roy, Spencer Johnson and Adam Zampa.

From the domestic side of things, Saif Badar, Unmukt Chand, Ali Khan, Nitish Kumar and Shadley Van Schalkwyk were retained. Ali Khan has been a fixture of the Knight Riders franchise and plays for them in the CPL with the Trinbago Knight Riders.

Chand returns to LAKR after missing out on selection to the USA squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup.

During the domestic draft, LAKR added Adithya Ganesh, Corné Dry, Derone Davis and Matthew Tromp to the team. LAKR will start their campaign in MLC season 2 against TSK on July 5.

title: USA women's T20 franchise tournament with world's best players could launch in near future
body:
A new women's T20 franchise tournament in the United States featuring the world's best players could be launched in the near future.

BBC Sport understands preliminary talks have taken place involving stakeholders in the US over its feasibility.

The inaugural season of Major League Cricket (MLC), a men's T20 tournament in the US, took place in 2023.

Discussions are said to be at a very early stage and no specific time frame has yet been established.

The US is preparing to co-host the men's T20 World Cup with the West Indies and the opening match will be played in Dallas on Sunday at 01:30 BST.

Cricket is also set to feature at the 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angeles, and influential figures in American cricket feel there is a unique window to grow domestic interest in the women's game.

The US women's national cricket team - who have never featured at a major International Cricket Council (ICC) event - are likely to qualify for the Olympic tournament as the host nation.

A number of franchise owners in MLC are understood to be open to the prospect of developing a women's team alongside their existing men's sides.

title: Los Angeles Knight Riders sign David Miller for the upcoming Major League Cricket
body:
The Los Angeles Knight Riders announced the marquee signing of South African batting star David Miller ahead of the Major League Cricket 2024 season. The hard-hitting left-hander joins the Knights after a good season with Texas Super Kings in the 2023 edition.

In the opening match of the 2023 season, Miller's fifty helped set up a 69-run win for the Super Kings over the Knight Riders. The 34-year-old has scored over 10,000 runs in his illustrious T20 career, with a blistering strike rate of 138.37.

Adding Miller to the batting order for the Knight Riders was a no-brainer after they finished dead last in 2023 with just a single win. His ability to clear the ropes and dominate in the death overs could be the difference maker in this season.

Miller joins a core of retained international players that includes Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, Jason Roy, Adam Zampa, and Spencer Johnson. This group had a poor season in the inaugural MLC season under Narine's captaincy.

Also read: Rashid, Klaasen, Pooran, Boult among 23 overseas retentions

Los Angeles to face Texas Super Kings in their first game

A new skipper could be a possibility to provide fresh leadership and allow Narine to focus solely on his bowling and explosive batting.

Regardless, LA Knight Riders' sister franchise the Kolkata Knight Riders lifted their third IPL title in the recently concluded 2024 edition. Russell and Narine had a big role to play in KKR lifting the title, and they would be confident to do so in the upcoming edition of MLC.

Also read: ICC gives official List A status to Major League Cricket ahead of second season

The Los Angeles-based side will kick off their MLC 2024 campaign against Miller's former franchise, Texas Super Kings.

title: US, Canada squads at the Twenty20 World Cup are a melting pot of nationalities
body:
The U.S. cricket team which will co-host the Twenty20 World Cup may be a fitting cross-section of its country as a roster of migrants, a melting pot of nationalities and cultures.

The 15-man squad includes players born in India, Pakistan, New Zealand and South Africa. Home-grown players include vice-captain Aaron Jones, who was born in Queens, and allrounder Steven Taylor, of Hialeah, Florida.

The team provides a snapshot of U.S. cricket at this formative stage, as Major League Cricket jostles for its place in a crowded sporting market. The squad includes foreign players drawn to America by the MLC and local players given the chance to play cricket at a professional level in the United States

The home team's most recognized member is the former New Zealand allrounder Corey Anderson. The 33-year-old Anderson played 13 tests, 49 one-day internationals and 31 T20 internationals for New Zealand between 2013 and 2018 in a career limited by injuries.

He earned a place in cricket history for his 36-ball century in a one-day international between New Zealand and the West Indies on New Year’s Day, 2014. Anderson also has played in T20 leagues in Australia, India, the Caribbean and United Arab Emirates before finding an MLC home at the San Francisco Unicorns.

Anderson made his first half-century for the U.S. in its T20 win over Canada last month.

Mumbai-born Harmeet Singh, who played for India at two Under-19 World Cups, was the star for the 19th-ranked U.S. team earlier this week in an upset win over Bangladesh. It the only the second win over a full ICC member for the U.S.

He scored 33 from the 13 deliveries he faced and shared an unbeaten, match-winning 62-run partnership with Anderson, who was unbeaten on 34.

“It means a lot to us to put on a show against Bangladesh. We are no walkovers,” Harmeet told ESPNcricinfo. “I think our potential is immense.”

The U.S. meets Canada in the tournament opener on June 1 and then there'll be a step up for both teams in Group A, which also includes India and Pakistan, fierce cricket rivals with enormous support, and Ireland.

Among the other foreign-born players on the U.S. squad coached by ex-Australia batter Stuart Law is right-arm fast bowler Ali Khan, who moved with his parents from Pakistan to the United States when he was 18.

He first played for the U.S. team in 2016 and has also has played in the Indian Premier League, Caribbean Premier League and Pakistan Premier League, in Global T20 Canada and the Afghanistan Premier League.

Captain Monank Patel, a wicketkeeper-batsman, was born in India and settled in New Jersey after moving permanently to the U.S. in 2016. He played at a junior level for Gujarat in India and played the first of his 47 one-day internationals and 23 T20 internationals for the U.S. in 2019.

Andries Gous, another wicketkeeper-batsmen, was born in Welkom, South Africa, played for South Africa at under-19 level and played 60 first-class matches before relocating to the U.S. in 2021. He and Patel were the highest scorers for the U.S. in the recent five-match series against Canada.

Allrounder Milind Kumar is another India-born player who accumulated nine centuries in 60 first-class appearances for Delhi before making his home in the U.S.

The Canada team scheduled to meet the U.S. in the opening match is also a team drawn from many places and shaped by the evolution of a professional league at home.

Canada will be led by the veteran left-armer spinner Saad bin Zafar, who was born in Pakistan. He moved to Canada to study and was first named in the Canadian T20 team in 2008. Now 37, he has played 38 T20 internationals and once took two wickets without conceding a run in four overs in a T20 against Panama.

Jamaica-born batter Aaron Johnson, Pakistan-born left-arm fast bowler Kaleem Sana and Guyana-born right-arm quick Dillon Heyliger reflect the international makeup of the team which is coached by former Sri Lanka international Pubudu Dassanayake.

title: USA To Launch WPL-Inspired Women's T20 Franchise Cricket Tournament After MLC
body:
RCB Women won the WPL 2024 (X)

Following the successful launch of Major League Cricket (MLC), plans are underway to establish a women's cricket league featuring top female cricket superstars in the world.

The USA is set to co-host the Men's T20 World Cup alongside the West Indies, with the tournament kicking off this week. As cricket gains popularity in the country, the USA is planning to invest more in the sport.

Cricket will also be part of the 2028 Olympics, further fueling the sport's momentum in the USA. Influential figures in American cricket believe there is a unique opportunity to grow domestic interest in the women's game.

MLC Women's in plans

This initiative could've drawn inspiration from the Women's Premier League (WPL) in India, which has already proven to be a massive success.

The USA women's cricket team, which has never participated in any ICC trophies, will naturally qualify for the 2028 Olympics as the host nation.

Reports indicate that franchise owners in Major League Cricket (MLC) are open to the prospect of developing women's teams alongside their existing men's sides.

This move is expected to improve the growth of women's cricket in the USA, providing more opportunities for female cricketers and increasing the sport's popularity.

title: Gujarat Titans Star David Miller Joins Knight Riders Family Ahead of MLC Season 2
body:
David Miller Signs with LA Knight Riders [x.com]

In a significant move for cricket fans, the Los Angeles Knight Riders have bolstered their roster for the upcoming Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season by signing South African powerhouse, David Miller.

The announcement, made by the team's official ‘X’ account, marks a pivotal moment for both the franchise and Miller's fans worldwide.

Renowned for his explosive batting and dynamic presence on the field, David Miller brings a wealth of experience to the Knight Riders at the age of 34.

With an illustrious career spanning various T20 leagues, including the IPL, PSL, and BPL, Miller's addition promises to inject vigor and proficiency into the Knight Riders' lineup.

After a challenging outing in the previous MLC season, where they finished at the bottom of the points table, the Knight Riders are poised for redemption in 2024.

The signing of Miller underscores their determination to bounce back stronger and reclaim their status as contenders in the league.

The excitement mounts as the MLC 2024 season approaches, with the Knight Riders set to commence their campaign against the Texas Super Kings on July 6th.

With Miller in their ranks, expectations soar as fans anticipate thrilling performances and a renewed sense of competitiveness from the LA franchise.

Operating under the umbrella of the Kolkata Knight Riders, recent IPL champions, the Los Angeles Knight Riders aim to emulate their sister franchise's success and carve their legacy in the burgeoning landscape of cricket leagues.

title: Can ragtag band who beat Bangladesh spur USA to T20 World Cup upset?
body:
Cricket is coming for one of the world’s great untapped markets. It will return to the Olympics in Los Angeles in 2028, Major League Cricket (MLC) is entering its second season — now recognised by the ICC with full list-A status — and a T20 World Cup on US soil is only days away. title: MLC gets List A status, eyes expansion to 10 teams
body:
USA's flagship T20 tournament, Major League Cricket (MLC) is eyeing a possible expansion to 10 teams. The MLC announced it will be expanding to an 8 team tournament within the space of two seasons and add two more to make it a 10 team franchise tournament eventually. The first season was played out in a single round robin format within 6 teams consisting of 19 games in a 3 week window.

While the second season will see an increase of 6 games, the league is further expected to grow with a home and away format in the future. In a 10 team league, the actual number of games are set to spike up to close to 100 games.

In a major shot in the arm for the MLC, the ICC put its weight behind this $120m fledgling league by imparting a List A status to its games. Inherently, all domestic T20 games in associate nations are left bereft of the List A status but ICC's approval for the List A status is an endorsement of the quality of cricket at display at the inaugural season of the MLC.

"We saw cricket mania sweep across the US last year off the back of our inaugural season of Major League Cricket. Now, we take exciting momentum into the highly anticipated ICC T20 World Cup and season two of the MLC" said Vijay Srinivasan CEO of MLC

The prospects of MLC propelling itself to be a 10 team tournament is seen as a bit unsettling to the English game. In its full glory MLC, may ultimately carve out a 10 week window for itself to accommodate the home and away format for all of its 10 teams. As it stands, the MLC is well placed in a buffer between the IPL and the Hundred in the cricket calendar. With American and English summers overlapping, there is a high chance the MLC and competitions like the Blast and Hundred duel it out to attract and reserve top talent within their windows.

Meanwhile, the American cricketing juggernaut has rolled along quietly on and off the field. The success of the inaugural season of the MLC has stimulated sponsorship from industry leaders like Cognizant and Stake. It is understood that the title sponsor Cognizant has pledged in close to $2m for the upcoming season. Furthermore, the USA men's historic series win over Bangladesh in the build up to their first world cup augurs well for American cricket, which finds itself in the midst of a T20 revolution.

title: Reports: New USA women's T20 franchise tournament to be in action soon
body:
Women's cricket could soon have a potential women's T20 franchise tournament in the United States. While still in the early stages, influential stakeholders in American cricket seem keen to capitalize on the unique window of opportunity presented. This is due to the country's hosting of the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics and the recent success of the inaugural Major League Cricket (MLC) men's T20 tournament.

With cricket set to make its Olympic debut in 2028 and the USA women's national team likely to qualify as hosts, there is a growing realization of the need to develop the women's game domestically. The remarkable rise of the Women's Premier League (WPL) in India, where stars worldwide earned good salaries, has further highlighted the commercial potential of women's T20 cricket.

While the project is still in the talking stage, the proposed tournament would aim to attract the world's best players and potentially operate alongside the existing men's franchises in the MLC.

Several MLC franchise owners, including the Ambani family that owns MI New York, have expressed interest in developing women's teams. This move could significantly boost the profile and earning potential of women's cricketers globally.

Also read: Threat looms over marquee event as weather destroys facilities to cancel USA-Bangladesh warm up fixture

USA to host its first ICC event

If the plans materialize, it could have far-reaching implications for the international commitments of England's women cricketers and their participation in domestic tournaments like The Hundred. The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) has already taken steps to increase earnings for its domestic women's players, but compared to the offers in the WPL, there is still less.

Launching a women's T20 franchise league in the USA would mark a significant milestone for the game. It would provide a platform for the world's best talent to showcase their skills and potentially inspire a new generation of American women cricketers.

Also read: Stuart Law opens up on USA's historic series win over Bangladesh

In the past few years, USA Cricket has pushed the ranks and established itself in cricket. Interestingly, the upcoming ICC men's T20 World Cup 2024 will be the first ICC event hosted in America.
